culturalContext.musicalContext: The 6-syllable structure (song lục) balances melody with text, common in Southern traditions. As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout.

culturalContext.musicalContext: The 7-syllable structure (lục bát's "bát" variant) allows extended melodic development and is common in literary songs. As the closing phrase, it typically returns to the tonic note and may quote the opening melody for circular structure. Onomatopoetic phrases use simple repeated pitches or rhythmic patterns to imitate the described sounds.
